Fluid Dynamics.formula: \nabla s= \frac{\partial s}{\partial x} \bar{i} + \frac{\partial s}{\partial y} \bar{j} + \frac{\partial s}{\partial z} \bar{k}

Fluid Dynamics.name: Divergence of a vector field (∇.v)
Fluid Dynamics.formula: \nabla .v= \frac{\partial v_{x}}{\partial x} + \frac{\partial v_{y}}{\partial y} + \frac{\partial v_{z}}{\partial z}

variables.∇∙v > 0: The fluid flowing along the velocity vector field becomes less dense.
variables.∇∙v = 0: The fluid is incompressible, then it can neither be a gain nor loss (Conservation of mass)

Fluid Dynamics.description: ∇∙v is a measure of the rate of loss of fluid per unit volume. It also measures the density fo fluid at every point.
